subject: Write tests for KanbanBoard page component
description:
## Goal
Write component tests for the KanbanBoard page following TDD.

## Test Cases

### Column rendering
- Renders 3 columns: Pending, In Progress, Completed
- Stories appear in the correct column based on their status
- Column headers show story count with a Separator below
- Each column uses ScrollArea for independent scrolling
- Empty columns show an appropriate empty state

### Loading state
- Shows Skeleton card placeholders in each column while stories are loading
- Skeletons disappear once data is fetched

### Story card collapsed state
- Shows story title
- Shows epic tag badge when story has an epic
- Does not show epic tag when story has no epic
- Shows compact progress bar with task count
- Shows pulsing dot when session is running for that story
- Pulsing dot shows Tooltip with session info on hover

### Story card expanded state
- Clicking chevron expands the card
- Expanded card shows full description
- Expanded card shows task list with status icons
- Expanded card shows progress bar
- Expanded card shows session indicator when running
- Expanded card has 'Open story' link pointing to /story/:id

### Real-time updates
- Component re-renders when story data changes in context
- Running session indicator appears/disappears based on session state

## Notes
Use the existing testing patterns in the project (Vitest + React Testing Library). Mock the `useDashboard` hook to provide test data.
guidance: Check existing component tests for patterns. Use @testing-library/react for rendering and assertions. Mock the dashboard context/hook.
